Salon Floor // Dawn Shift
Twin Bakers Union Hall

Two ovens, one uprising, every loaf signed in butter.

At first light, Sable and Marrow split the city with rival sourdough banners, then stitched it back together under one tablecloth. Bread is now served like couture: velvet crumb, lacquered crust, and a vow that no guest enters without answering the house riddle.

We flour the counters like snowfall, press fingerprints into warm dough, and leave one chair open for whatever spirit still wants a slice.
Admission Terminal // Gate Riddle

The door asks once.

I rise without legs, feed crowds without teeth, and vanish if ignored. What am I?

Awaiting your answer. The brass handle is warm.
Collections // House Signatures

Daily Lines

Sable Line: black sesame milk bread, mirror glaze finish.

Marrow Line: honey-laced brioche braided with citrus peel.

Truce Loaf: twin-ferment pain de campagne, limited at dusk.

Private tasting seatings begin 06:40 and 19:10 daily. Walk-ins accepted if the riddle is solved before the bell.

FAQ // Policy and Ritual

Before You Visit

Are children welcome?

Yes. We provide gentler riddles before noon and low-salt samplers on request.

How are complaints handled?

Every written complaint is placed under the ashwood Ouija board at 21:00. Replies are posted by 09:00 next morning.

Do you accommodate allergies?

Yes. Tell the host at arrival and we will mark your table with a silver wheat token for priority handling.
